choices: I prefer to play with my food instead of eat my food.
Staring at the humans, judgingly.
My 4 am play session with all my toys.
Look quietly from where I am, the bird is not worth getting excited over.
Sometimes I'll just throw up.
Surprisingly high-pitched.
I am literally the cutest.
bio: Smokey was the first foster cat that started it all! He was a shy but playful boy. He loved batting around pieces of his Meow Mix as if they were hockey pucks. Smokey loved to lay on you in the morning meow for his wet food at night.

choices: I'm more of a grazer.
Sleeeeeeeeep.
Transitioning from my resting place on the couch to my resting place on the bed.
I'm probably sleeping.
I'm actually perfect and how dare you insinuate that I'm not.
MEAAAAH.
I am literally the cutest.
bio: Hyacinth (formerly named Hilda) was the sweetest old lady at 14 years old. She loved and trusted everyone. She loved licking your hands and face. She was a thin girl at 5 pounds and had a mass on her eye that was scheduled to be removed after she gained enought weight to go in for surgery. Unfortunately, she passed before she could make it. Rest in peace, Hyacinth.

choices: 6pm sharp.
I like to lie on keyboards and walk across the screen on zoom meetings.
I get the zoomies as soon as the sun goes down.
Run up to the window and chatter -- that bird is mine!
I'm a plant eater. No house plant is safe.
I kind of sound like an old man grunting.
I am the best lap cat around.
bio: Bo (formerly named Jack) is the strongest cat I've fostered. He was placed into foster because he was showing signs of fear at the shelter, and he immediately called his new place home. He loved sprawling on keyboards and being the center of attention. This handsome kitty was quickly adopted.

I am a cat, what more do you want?
bio: Tango's stay with us was short but memorable. He wouldn't eat his prescription food, but would steal Eggo waffles and tortilla chips right out of our hands. He was a very determined kitty and once turned a doorknob on a closed door and escapted the bedroom.

bio: Dexter was a big boy with a gentle personality. He was diagnosed with FLUTD (Feline lower urinary tract disease), but he didn't let that stop him! He was a shy boy that loved cuddles from his preferred human, and sometimes he would settle for his second favorite human. He was very expressive, and his most distinctive meow was his 'give me my wet food meow'.

bio: Luther stayed with us only a few days before he found his forever home. He was the cuddliest cat and would regularly fall asleep in the closest lap. He loved humans and especially enjoyed sleeping under the covers at night.

bio: Edna (true name Cupcake) was found on the streets of Pittsburgh. Suspected to be a lost cat, the rescue organization did their super sleuthing and found her owners who had been looking for her for weeks since she escaped. On a snowy night, she was returned to her owners who were overjoyed to have her back. In her relatively short time in foster, her most distinctive trait was her appetite. You could not walk anywhere without her following you and demanding food.

bio: Maya stayed under the bed for eight days straight when I first started fostering her. It took time for her to get comfortable, but she became the sassiest cat I've fostered. Her favorite toys were anything filled with catnip.

bio: Mufasa (aka MooMoo) was a big and loveable orange tabby. His favorite resting spot was my keyboard. On Zoom meetings, I often had to excuse myself to stop him from eating the shower curtains.

bio: Ollie was almost a working barn cat, but thankfully a volunteer at the shelter realized his true potential and took him home. He turned out to be the sweetest cat who learned to love every human he met. He was an exceptionally smart kitty who could open drawers and cabinents. His favorite way to pass the time was to hop up on you for shoulder rides. Ollie was food motivated and would go after anything that resembled food.

bio: Darla was a cute little calico who had the energy to play for hours and who chewed through most of her toys. She loved running out in front of you and stopping right in your path, but she was the most adorable tripping hazard. She was FELV+ positive and the cutest cat around.
